triviaQuestions.question: The piano is generally considered to a member of what two instrument families?
triviaQuestions.hint: Not quite! Here's a hint: look inside any piano and you'll see lots of strings being struck by mallets...
triviaQuestions.followupFact: Concert pianos have 88 strings. The smallest strings can be as short as a pinky while the largest strings can be taller than you!

triviaQuestions.question: The "buttons" you press on a piano to make music are called what?
triviaQuestions.hint: Not quite! Here's a hint: how do you type things into a computer?
triviaQuestions.followupFact: Concert pianos have 88 keys: 52 white and 36 black.

triviaQuestions.question: What is the name of the part of the piano where your feet are placed?
triviaQuestions.hint: Here's a hint: you also use these when riding a bike!
triviaQuestions.followupFact: Piano pedals can enrich the sound in various ways, such as causing a note to play softer, or be held longer.

triviaQuestions.question: What kind of piano plays songs all by itself off of a big roll of paper?
triviaQuestions.hint: Here's a hint:  Dont hate THIS, hate the game.
triviaQuestions.followupFact: When a player piano is running, the keys still move up and down - even though there isn't a person pressing them!
